statement.p: Consider the note F4 which has frequency 369.994 Hz.
What is the period for F4?
What is the wavelength for F4? ft
Recall that the speed of sound is 1116 feet per second.
These are scientific measurements; round accordingly.

solution.p: Period is the inverse of frequency, so \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{369.994}}\approx{0.0027027465310248}\approx{0.00270275}.
Wavelength is a unit conversion: \displaystyle\frac{{{1116}\ \text{ ft}}}{{\text{second}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ \text{ second}}}{{{369.994}\ \text{ cycles}}}\approx{3.0162651286237}\approx{3.016}.
